title: Open-Label Positron Emission Tomography Study With Selective Beta Amyloid Radioligand (18Fluor)AZD4694 to Assess the Effects of Varying Mass of AZD4694 on Radioligand Binding Parameters in Healthy Volunteers and Patients With Alzheimer's Disease
description_brief: In this study different mass of the radioligand AZD4694 will be given to patients with Alzheimer's Disease and healthy volunteers to evaluate wich Mass of AZD4694 that gives the best opportunities for following disease progress and treatment effects.
description_detailed: Open-Label Positron Emission Tomography Study with Selective Beta Amyloid Radioligand (18Fluor)AZD4694 to Assess the Effects of Varying Mass of AZD4694 on Radioligand Binding Parameters in Healthy Volunteers and Patients with Alzheimer's Disease
explanation_target: Reason: The intervention is a PET radioligand given to subjects to image beta-amyloid (i.e., a diagnostic imaging tracer), not a therapeutic agent intended to modify disease or cognition. The trial title and description state this is an open‑label PET study of varying mass of AZD4694 to assess radioligand binding parameters. citeturn0search6

Act: AZD4694 (also reported in the literature as [18F]AZD4694 or NAV4694/18F‑NAV4694) is a fluorine‑18 labeled amyloid‑β selective PET tracer developed for imaging plaque burden; multiple validation and characterization studies describe it as an imaging agent (not a therapeutic drug). citeturn0search4turn0search3

Reflect: Because the study is evaluating diagnostic imaging mass/dose effects and radioligand binding (to follow disease progress/treatment effects), it fits the diagnostic/biomarker category rather than any of the four therapeutic categories (disease‑targeted biologic, disease‑targeted small molecule, cognitive enhancer, or neuropsychiatric symptom improvement). Therefore the correct classification per the provided categories is 'N/A'. citeturn0search6turn0search1

Supporting web search results (key sources used): (1) Characterization paper describing AZD4694 as a novel 18F amyloid plaque PET radioligand (K_d ≈2.3 nM). citeturn0search4 (2) Clinical validation of 18F‑AZD4694 as an amyloid‑β specific PET radioligand suitable for diagnostic use and evaluation in trials. citeturn0search3 (3) Longitudinal study using [18F]AZD4694 for monitoring amyloid plaque accumulation, supporting its use as an imaging biomarker. citeturn0search1 (4) Trial registry/description for the open‑label PET study assessing varying mass of AZD4694 (trial NCT01325402 / listing). citeturn0search6turn0search7
